definition: to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: At that time, I still don't know the father of the young imports.
sentences.chinese: 当时，我年幼还不知道父亲的用意何在。

sentences.english: This is the intention of my paper.
I'm exaggerating but I do so to make a point.
sentences.chinese: 这是夸张的讲法，但我这么说有其用意。

sentences.english: The EU reckons that Intel's use of such rebates was nefarious.
sentences.chinese: 欧盟认为，英特尔利用返点促销用意恶毒。

sentences.english: My readers know what I’m getting at.
sentences.chinese: 读者诸君想必知道我用意所在。

sentences.english: Nobody could dope out what he meant.
sentences.chinese: 没有人能理解他用意何在。

sentences.english: I wonder what lay behind the president's speech.
sentences.chinese: 我不知总统的这篇演说用意何在。

sentences.english: He lounged in an left armchair in a stance of deliberconsumed contempt.
sentences.chinese: 他懒洋洋地躺在扶手椅里，用意摆出一种藐视的架势。

sentences.english: Daughter side, looked at his father's doubts about the his intention.
sentences.chinese: 女儿站在一边，疑惑地望着父亲，弄不清他的用意。

sentences.english: He had some motive in telling this fable.
sentences.chinese: 他讲这寓言故事是有用意的。

sentences.english: The other reason to spend money slowly is to encourage a culture of cheapness.
sentences.chinese: 另一个节省开支的用意是形成一种勤俭的文化。

sentences.english: His beating around the bush manners of speaking has made it difficult for us to fathom his true intention.
sentences.chinese: 他讲得很转弯抹角，我们难以摸透他的真正用意。

sentences.english: A rhetorical question is intended to draw attention to a subsequent statement.
sentences.chinese: 反诘问句的用意在让人注意后续的陈述。
我终于明白了他的用意。

sentences.english: I couldn't help wondering about the intention of a handful of people who tend to spread such accusations.
sentences.chinese: 有些人经常散布此类言论，不知道他们用意何在。

sentences.english: This is couched in diplomatic language, but the intention is clear.
sentences.chinese: 这是措辞在外交辞令，但用意是清楚的。

definition: to harbor (evil) intentions/to be bent on/a tranquil heart or mind
unspoken implication (idiom)/the actual meaning of what was said
profound theory (in Daoism and Buddhism)/mysterious principles
inside information/the ins and outs of the matter/how things stand/what's up
